storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to reschedule conflicting appointments to resolve scheduling conflicts efficiently

testCases.title: Reschedule conflicting appointment successfully
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with rescheduling permissions
At least one appointment conflict exists in the system
Conflict alert is visible and accessible to the user
Available time slots exist in the calendar for rescheduling
Appointment database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict alert dashboard and locate a conflicting appointment
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is displayed with appointment details and available action options

steps.action: Click on the 'Reschedule' option from the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view opens displaying available time slots without conflicts, current appointment details are visible

steps.action: Review the available time slots in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows available slots clearly marked, conflicting slots are disabled or marked as unavailable

steps.action: Select a new time slot that does not have any conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Selected time slot is highlighted, system begins validation process

steps.action: Wait for system to validate the selected time slot
steps.expectedResult: System validates the new time slot successfully, displays confirmation message that the slot is available, validation completes within 3 seconds

steps.action: Click the 'Confirm Reschedule' button to finalize the change
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking user to verify the rescheduling action

steps.action: Confirm the rescheduling action in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is successfully updated with new time, success message is displayed, operation completes within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify the conflict status in the conflict alert dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is automatically cleared from the alert list, appointment shows updated time, conflict status is marked as resolved

postconditions: Appointment is rescheduled to the new time slot
Conflict alert is removed from the dashboard
Conflict status is updated to 'Resolved' in the database
Appointment database reflects the updated time
No new conflicts are created by the rescheduling

testCases.title: Prevent rescheduling to conflicting time
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with rescheduling permissions
At least one appointment conflict exists in the system
Conflict alert is visible and accessible to the user
Multiple appointments exist creating potential conflicts
Calendar view is accessible with both available and conflicting time slots

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict alert dashboard and select a conflicting appointment
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert details are displayed with reschedule option available

steps.action: Click on the 'Reschedule' option from the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view opens showing available and unavailable time slots

steps.action: Attempt to select a time slot that already has a conflicting appointment scheduled
steps.expectedResult: Time slot is selected and highlighted, system initiates validation

steps.action: Wait for system validation of the selected conflicting time slot
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a validation error message indicating the selected time conflicts with another appointment

steps.action: Review the error message details
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly states the conflict reason, shows conflicting appointment details, and prevents the reschedule action from proceeding

steps.action: Verify that the 'Confirm Reschedule' button is disabled or unavailable
steps.expectedResult: Confirm button is disabled or not clickable, preventing user from completing the invalid reschedule

steps.action: Attempt to click the disabled 'Confirm Reschedule' button
steps.expectedResult: No action occurs, button remains disabled, error message persists

steps.action: Verify the original appointment remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Original appointment time is unchanged, conflict status remains active, no updates are made to the database

postconditions: Original appointment time remains unchanged
Conflict alert remains active in the dashboard
No database updates are performed
Error message is displayed to guide user to select valid time slot
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid reschedule

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to override scheduling conflicts with permission to handle exceptional cases

testCases.title: Authorized user overrides conflict successfully
preconditions: User is logged in with authorized role that has override permissions
User role is configured in the system with override access rights
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
Conflict alert is visible and accessible
Audit logging system is operational and accessible
Conflict database is accessible for updates

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict alert dashboard and locate a conflict that requires override
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is displayed with conflict details and available action options including 'Override' button

steps.action: Click on the 'Override' option on the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: System initiates permission check, validates user has override authorization

steps.action: Wait for system to complete permission validation
steps.expectedResult: System confirms user has required permissions, displays confirmation dialog prompting user to confirm the override action

steps.action: Review the confirmation dialog details including conflict information and override implications
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog displays conflict details, warning about override action, and options to 'Confirm' or 'Cancel'

steps.action: Click the 'Confirm' button in the override confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: System processes the override request, operation completes within 2 seconds, success message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the conflict status has been updated in the conflict alert dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is marked as 'Overridden', conflict alert is removed or status updated, appointments remain scheduled despite conflict

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log section or access audit log records
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface is accessible and displays recent entries

steps.action: Search for the override action entry in the audit log using conflict ID or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is found with complete details

steps.action: Verify the audit log entry contains all required information
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes user ID/name who performed override, timestamp of action, conflict ID, appointment details, and override reason if applicable

postconditions: Conflict is successfully overridden in the system
Conflict status is updated to 'Overridden'
Both conflicting appointments remain scheduled
Audit log contains complete record of override action with user details and timestamp
Override action is traceable for compliance purposes
System maintains audit trail for future reference

testCases.title: Unauthorized user cannot override conflict
preconditions: User is logged in with a role that does NOT have override permissions
User role is configured without override access rights in the system
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
Conflict alert is visible and accessible to the user
Role-based access control is properly configured and enforced
Security permissions are active and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict alert dashboard as an unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert dashboard is displayed with existing conflicts

steps.action: Locate a conflict alert and check for available action options
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details are visible, override option may be hidden or disabled based on permissions

steps.action: Attempt to click on the 'Override' option if visible, or attempt to access override functionality through any available means
steps.expectedResult: System initiates permission check for the user attempting the override action

steps.action: Wait for system to validate user permissions
steps.expectedResult: System detects user lacks required override permissions, denies the override request

steps.action: Observe the system response to the unauthorized override attempt
steps.expectedResult: System displays clear error message stating 'You do not have permission to override conflicts' or similar authorization error, operation is blocked

steps.action: Verify that no confirmation dialog appears for the override action
steps.expectedResult: No confirmation dialog is displayed, user cannot proceed with override

steps.action: Check the conflict status in the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict status remains unchanged, no override is recorded, conflict remains active

steps.action: Verify no audit log entry is created for the failed override attempt
steps.expectedResult: No override action is logged since the action was denied at permission check, or a failed attempt may be logged for security purposes

postconditions: Conflict remains in its original state
No override action is performed
Conflict status is unchanged
User receives clear error message about insufficient permissions
System security is maintained by preventing unauthorized overrides
No unauthorized changes are made to the database
Role-based access control is enforced successfully

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to track conflict resolution status to monitor scheduling health

testCases.title: Track and update conflict resolution status
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict database is accessible and operational
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
User has permissions to view and resolve conflicts
Dashboard is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling system and trigger a conflict detection by attempting to schedule overlapping resources or time slots
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and automatically sets the conflict status to 'pending' in the conflict database

steps.action: Verify the conflict status is recorded by querying GET /conflicts/status API endpoint or checking the conflict record in the database
steps.expectedResult: Conflict record exists with status='pending', timestamp of detection, and conflict details are accurately recorded

steps.action: Access the conflict resolution interface and select the pending conflict from the list
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details are displayed with current status showing as 'pending' and resolution options are available

steps.action: Apply a resolution action by either rescheduling one of the conflicting items or selecting an override option, then submit the resolution
steps.expectedResult: System processes the resolution action and updates the conflict status to 'resolved' via PUT /conflicts/{id}/status API endpoint

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict dashboard by clicking on the dashboard menu or accessing the dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads within 3 seconds and displays all conflicts including the recently resolved conflict

steps.action: Locate the previously resolved conflict in the dashboard view and verify its status display
steps.expectedResult: The conflict is displayed with status='resolved', shows resolution timestamp, resolution method applied, and user who resolved it

postconditions: Conflict status is updated to 'resolved' in the database
Conflict resolution is recorded in historical data
Dashboard reflects the updated conflict status
Audit trail of status change is logged

testCases.title: Filter and sort conflicts on dashboard
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict dashboard is accessible
Multiple conflicts exist with different statuses (pending, resolved, overridden)
Conflicts have different creation dates
User has permissions to view conflict data
Dashboard has loaded successfully

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict dashboard and wait for the initial load to complete
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads within 3 seconds displaying all conflicts with various statuses and dates

steps.action: Locate the status filter dropdown or filter panel on the dashboard interface
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are visible and include all available status values: 'pending', 'resolved', and 'overridden'

steps.action: Select 'pending' from the status filter dropdown and apply the filter
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays only conflicts with status='pending', all other status conflicts are hidden from view

steps.action: Verify the filtered results by checking each displayed conflict's status field
steps.expectedResult: All displayed conflicts show status='pending', count of displayed conflicts matches the number of pending conflicts, no resolved or overridden conflicts are visible

steps.action: Clear the status filter or select 'All' to display all conflicts again
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays all conflicts regardless of status

steps.action: Locate the sort options and click on the 'Date' column header or select 'Sort by Date' from the sort dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Sort control is activated and sort direction indicator (ascending/descending arrow) is displayed

steps.action: Apply ascending date sort and verify the order of conflicts displayed
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are sorted by date in ascending order (oldest first), with dates progressing chronologically from top to bottom of the list

steps.action: Click the date sort control again to reverse the sort order to descending
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are re-sorted by date in descending order (newest first), with most recent conflicts appearing at the top of the list

steps.action: Combine filters by applying status filter 'pending' while maintaining the date sort
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only pending conflicts sorted by date in the selected order, both filter and sort are applied simultaneously

postconditions: Dashboard maintains the applied filters and sort preferences
Filter and sort selections are preserved during the session
No data integrity issues occur from filtering and sorting operations
Dashboard performance remains within 3 seconds for filter/sort operations
